New Records: The Chicago White Sox tied the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record of 120 losses in a season
Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi hit a tiebreaking, two-out single in the eighth inning
Jonathan Cannon pitched three-hit ball over six scoreless innings
Jack López connected for his first career homer
Hunter Strickland gave up back-to-back doubles to Zach DeLoach and Bryan Ramos
Lenyn Sosa's RBI single in the eighth inning
Nicky Lopez's defensive miscue leading to the White Sox's win
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox had a 37-120 record before the game
Fans chanted "Sell the team!" during the game
The team was 0-94 before the eighth inning rally
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Benintendi commented on the fans' reactions and the team's resilience
Jack López expressed disappointment over a defensive error
Jonathan Cannon's strong pitching performance was noted
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans booed Los Angeles’ Eric Wagaman’s groundout to end the game
The White Sox had five games remaining after the win
The article referenced the 1968 and 1980 Angels' franchise records
